alert.note: Alert for Gove; Logan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Logan and southwestern Gove Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 658 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Russell Springs, or 17 miles northwest of Scott State Lake, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Logan and southwestern Gove Counties, including the following locations... The Monument Rocks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Kansas.
